intro: Nurmonia pulchella, commonly known as the pink bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in well-drained environments. Nurmonia pulchella is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
